info.name: NovaPost Client API
info.description:
Postman Collection for API NovaPost v.1.0 methods

**Registration:**

- Email [servicedesk@novapost.com](https://mailto:servicedesk@novapost.com) to register a user for the API.
    
- During the registration process, you will receive an API access key.
    

**Authentication:**

- Set provided API key as a value in Collection Variables {{apiKey}}.
    
- Executing "Generate a temporary JWT-token" request will generate and set your JWT token as a Collection Variable {{jwt}}.
    
- JWT Token will have a lifetime of 1 hour and further will need a refresh by running the "Generate a temporary JWT-token" request again.
    
- JWT-token needs to be used for each API request, this collection was configured to use Collection Variable {{jwt}}.
    

**Endpoint Definition:**

- [https://api.novapost.com/v.1.0](https://api.novapost.com/v.1.0) - Production environment
    
- [https://api-stage.novapost.pl/v.1.0](https://api-stage.novapost.pl/v.1.0) - Test environment

item.name: Test api-stage.novapost.com
Authorization

query.description: Your unique API key obtained from servicedesk@novapost.com

request.description:
**Overview**:  
The Nova Post API uses secure authentication mechanisms to protect API access and ensure data integrity. To interact with the API, you must generate a **JWT (JSON Web Token)** using your API key.

**Purpose**:  
Authorization ensures that only authorized users or applications can access the Nova Post API endpoints. JWT tokens enable stateless authentication, allowing users to make secure API calls without needing repeated reauthentication.

**Response**:

- On success, the server returns a JWT token with a limited lifespan.
    
- The token must be included in the `Authorization` header (as a Bearer token) for subsequent requests (will be done automatically within current collection using collection variables if request was successful).
    

**Sample Response**:

``` json
{
"jwt": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..."
} 

 ```

**Key Notes**:

1. Tokens are temporary and will expire wthin 1 hour after generation.
    
2. Rotate or refresh tokens as needed using the same API key by re running current request.
    
3. Always store tokens securely to prevent unauthorized access.

query.description: Your unique API key obtained from servicedesk@novapost.com

item.description: ## Folder contains following method: - Generate a temporary JWT-token **GET /clients/authorization** > This collection was configured using variables for apiKey and jwt token. Once API key is inserted in to Collection Variables (variable **apiKey**, example value: fa89b64e2a9248cbbc3124e678d88ab2 ) - request in current folder needs to be executed first. All further requests will have jwt token added automatically. This API method allows you to generate a temporary JSON Web Token (JWT) that will be stored in collection variables and will be automatically added to every subsequent request to ensure proper authentication and authorization. To utilize this method, a personal API key is required. The request for generating a temporary JWT-token should contain your API key as an authentication parameter. Upon a successful request, the response will include the temporary JWT-token, which must be securely stored and included in the header or authentication section of all subsequent requests to access API resources properly. If you need to acquire a personal API key, please contact your manager for assistance.

item.name: Dictionaries

query.description: Max number of items to return.
Page number to return.

To receive a list of cargo warehouses and parcel lockers in a certain country please choose required country code from the list. Use code, according to the ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 standard.
Allowed: CZ ┃ DE ┃ EE ┃ HU ┃ LT ┃ LV ┃ MD ┃ PL ┃ RO ┃ SK ┃ UA

request.description:
This API method enables you to obtain a list of own and partner\`s cargo warehouses (divisions) and parcel lockers available within countries. By providing the country code as a parameter, you can retrieve a comprehensive list of cargo warehouses and related details. The response will typically include information like warehouse name, number, address, ID, country and city details, warehouse type, and other relevant attributes. This data can be useful to generate a transportation document (shipment).

**Response**:  
On success, the API returns paginated results with information about each division, including its attributes and operational details.

**Example Response**:

``` json
jsonCopy code{
 ```

request.description: This API method allows you to retrieve a list of currencies that are available for creating transportation documents. By making a request with this method, you can obtain a list of currencies supported by the system. The response will include details of each currency, such as the currency code, name, and any other relevant information. This data can be useful to generate a transportation document (shipment).

request.description: This API method allows you to retrieve a list of cargo classifiers (UKT ZED). Cargo classifiers are predefined categories or classifications used to categorize different types of cargo. By making a request to this method, you can obtain a list of cargo classifiers supported by the system. The response will include details of each classifier, such as the classifier ID, name, description, category, examples and any other relevant information. This data can be useful to generate a transportation document (shipment).

request.description: This API method enables you to retrieve a list of transportation documents (shipments) that you have created. By making a request with this method, you can access the transportation documents that belongs to you or your account. The response will include details of each shipment, such as the shipment ID, number, recipient, cargo detail, and other relevant information. Method has an option to limit the number of results and paginate through the data. You may use searching by shipment id or shipment number by adding these to query params: ### Response The response will be in JSON format(response in example section below) Key Response Fields: 1. **current_page**: Current page number of the results (1). 2. **last_page**: Total pages available in the results (1). 3. **per_page**: Number of items per page (1). 4. **total**: Total number of items available (1). 5. **items**: List of shipments containing details like: - **id**: Unique shipment ID. - **sender**: Sender details including name, address, contact. - **recipient**: Recipient details similar to sender. - **parcels**: Parcel details including dimensions, weight, and description. - **services**: List of services with pricing and description. - **tracking**: Shipment tracking events.

request.description:
### Create Shipment

This API method is engineered to streamline the process of generating a shipping document for logistics operations through Nova Post. By submitting key data, such as the originating and destination addresses for the shipment, users can effortlessly create a document detailing the transportation of goods. This method includes optional fields for customs authorities, accommodating shipments that cross borders. The API response will provide the unique identifier of the generated document along with other relevant information.

- Method: POST
    
- URL: `https://api-stage.novapost.com/v.1.0/shipments`
    

#### Response Example:

``` json
{
    "id": 376860,
    "number": "SHPL2896131485",
    "scheduledDeliveryDate": "2024-11-21T08:20:00.000000Z",
    "status": "ReadyToShip",
    "cost": 12,
    "parcelsAmount": 1,
    "createdAt": "2024-11-20T01:09:41.636352Z",
    "updatedAt": "2024-11-20T01:09:41.636352Z",
    "deletedAt": null,
    "deliveryPartners": [],
    "services": [
        {
            "id": "1092084",
            "shipmentId": "376860",
            "shipmentParcelRowNumber": "1",
            "serviceId": "5637144578",
            "amount": 1,
            "contractNumber": null,
            "payerType": "Sender",
            "paymentStatus": "NeedPay",
            "divisionId": null,
            "price": 12,
            "discount": 0,
            "cost": 12,
            "currencyCode": "PLN",
            "user": "13b0f247-1a51-11ed-a361-48df37b92096",
            "shipmentLockVersion": 1,
            "additionalParameters": {},
            "createdAt": "2024-11-20T01:09:41.636352Z",
            "updatedAt": "2024-11-20T01:09:41.636352Z"
        }
    ]
}

 ```

#### Response Fields:

- **id**: A unique identifier assigned to each shipment, facilitating internal operations such as modifications, system searches, and deletion of shipments. The 'id' serves as a key reference for administrative and logistical processes within the delivery system, allowing precise access and management of shipment records.
    
- **number**: The transportation document number provided to clients for tracking purposes and accessing printed forms. It also facilitates shipment searches within the system, offering a customer-friendly way to monitor shipment progress. While 'number' is used externally for tracking and documentation, it can also serve internal needs similar to 'id' for identifying shipments in certain system operations. Pattern: ^\[A-Z\]{4}\\d{10}$.
    
- **scheduledDeliveryDate**: Estimated delivery date based on routing and service level, subject to change based on logistics and external factors.
    
- **status**: Current status of the shipment. Initially set to "ReadyToShip" upon creation, indicating it's prepared for dispatch.
    
- **cost**: Total cost calculated for the delivery services provided, based on shipment size, weight, destination, and service options selected.
    
- **parcelsAmount**: The total number of parcels included in the shipment. This count helps in logistics planning and tracking.Constraints: Min 1
    
- **createdAt**: Timestamp when the shipment was created.
    
- **updatedAt**: The last timestamp when the shipment record was updated. Helps in tracking changes and updates made to the shipment details.

request.description:
This API method allows you to calculate the estimated delivery cost for your cargo based on various factors such as weight, dimensions, destination, and shipping method. By providing the necessary details of your cargo and shipment, you can obtain an estimated cost for delivering the goods. The response will typically include the approximate calculated cost based on the provided information.

#### Response Example:

``` json
{
    "sender": {
        "countryCode": "PL",
        "settlementId": 22326,
        "divisionId": 948389
    },
    "recipient": {
        "countryCode": "PL",
        "settlementId": 22326,
        "divisionId": 1888291
    },
    "services": [
        {
            "serviceId": "5637144578",
            "serviceName": "Document delivery",
            "serviceCode": "Document",
            "amount": 1,
            "price": 12,
            "currencyCode": "PLN",
            "cost": 12
        }
    ]
}

 ```

  

#### Response Fields:

- **sender**: Provides the sender's basic geographical information as part of the shipment's origin details in the response. This object outlines the sender’s country and may include additional location identifiers like settlement and division IDs if available.
    
- **recipient**: Provides the recipient's basic geographical information as part of the shipment's delivery details in the response. This object outlines the recipient’s country and may include additional location identifiers like settlement and division IDs if available.
    
- **services**: A collection of services associated with the shipment, each entry detailing specific services applied or requested for the shipment. This array encompasses various service details such as type of service, amount, and contractual details, along with any additional parameters that specify further service-related requirements or conditions.

request.description:
This API method enables you to update an existing transportation document by providing the document ID and the complete set of updated data. By specifying the document ID and including all the necessary information, you can replace the old document with the new data provided in the request. The response will typically indicate the success of the update operation and may include details of StartFragmentEndFragment  
  
the modified document.

StartFragment

#### Response Example:

``` json
{
    "id": 301010,
    "number": "SHPL0239705199",
    "scheduledDeliveryDate": "2024-09-06T06:00:00.000000Z",
    "status": "ReadyToShip",
    "cost": 55,
    "parcelsAmount": 1,
    "createdAt": "2024-09-03T12:21:06.453809Z",
    "updatedAt": "2024-09-03T12:50:20.158966Z",
    "deletedAt": null,
    "deliveryPartners": []
}

 ```

#### Response Fields:

- **id**: Shipment id. A unique identifier assigned to each shipment, facilitating internal operations such as modifications, system searches, and deletion of shipments. The 'id' serves as a key reference for administrative and logistical processes within the delivery system, allowing precise access and management of shipment records.Constraints: Min 1
    
- **number**: Shipment number. The transportation document number provided to clients for tracking purposes and accessing printed forms. It also facilitates shipment searches within the system, offering a customer-friendly way to monitor shipment progress. While 'number' is used externally for tracking and documentation, it can also serve internal needs similar to 'id' for identifying shipments in certain system operations.Pattern: ^\[A-Z\]{4}\\d{10}$
    
- **scheduledDeliveryDate**: Estimated delivery date based on routing and service level, subject to change based on logistics and external factors.
    
- **status**: Current status of the shipment. Initially set to "ReadyToShip" upon creation, indicating it's prepared for dispatch.
    
- **cost**: Total cost calculated for the delivery services provided, based on shipment size, weight, destination, and service options selected.
    
- **parcelsAmount**: The total number of parcels included in the shipment. This count helps in logistics planning and tracking.Constraints: Min 1
    
- **createdAt**: Timestamp when the shipment was created
    
- **updatedAt**: The last timestamp when the shipment record was updated. Helps in tracking changes and updates made to the shipment details.
    
- **deletedAt**: The timestamp when the shipment was canceled or removed from the system. If not canceled, this field is null.

request.description:
This method allows business clients to create a new courier pickup request by specifying essential parameters such as the pickup address, parcel type, and additional details.

**Initial Status (****`Draft`****)**: The pickup request is created in the `Draft` status, which allows clients to add all necessary shipments to the request.

**Transition to** **`Created`**: Once all shipments are added, clients must use the "Update pickup request status" method to change the status to `Created`. This indicates that the pickup is finalized and ready for processing by the courier service.

**Time Intervals**: To include a specific time interval for the pickup, clients should retrieve available time intervals using the corresponding method. This ensures that the requested pickup time aligns with the courier's schedule and availability.

This method is available to business clients in EU countries where Nova Post operates.

#### Request Body

- **note**: Type: string, Description: Optional notes or instructions for the courier, Constraints: Max 255 chars.
    
- **services**: Type: \[string\], Description: List of additional services that can be included in the pickup request. This functionality is currently under development, Constraints: —.
    
- **phone**: Type: string, Description: The contact phone number of the sender, required to allow the courier to reach out if necessary, Constraints: 8 to 14 chars.
    
- **email**: Type: string┃null, Description: While not mandatory, providing an email is recommended as a backup contact method in case the phone number is incorrect or for additional notifications, Constraints: —.
    
- **fullName**: Type: string, Description: Full name of the client sending the parcel, essential for identifying the sender and ensuring accurate handling of the pickup, Constraints: Max 100 chars.
    
- **companyTin**: Type: string, Description: The contract number of the requesting company, Constraints: 2 to 20 chars.
    
- **companyName**: Type: string, Description: Name of the company requesting the pickup, Constraints: 2 to 255 chars.
    
- **countryCode**: Type: string, Description: ISO Alpha-2 code for the pickup location, Constraints: Pattern: ^\[A-Z\]{2}$.
    
- **addressParts**: Type: object, Description: Detailed address information for the pickup location, Constraints: —.
    
- **city**: Type: string, Description: The name of the city for the pickup location, Constraints: Max 100 chars.
    
- **region**: Type: string, Description: The administrative area, state, or region for the pickup, Constraints: Max 100 chars.
    
- **street**: Type: string, Description: The street name for the pickup location, Constraints: Max 100 chars.
    
- **postCode**: Type: string, Description: The postal code of the pickup location, Constraints: Max 10 chars.
    
- **building**: Type: string, Description: The building number or name at the pickup address, Constraints: Max 100 chars.
    
- **flat**: Type: string, Description: The apartment or office number within the building, Constraints: Max 10 chars.
    
- **block**: Type: string, Description: The specific block or section within a larger complex, if applicable, Constraints: Max 100 chars.
    
- **note**: Type: string, Description: Additional instructions for the courier to access the pickup location, Constraints: Max 100 chars.
    
- **pickedTimeFrom**: Type: date-time┃null, Description: Start of the pickup time window, selected from available time intervals provided by the method that returns available time slots, Constraints: Pattern: ^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$.
    
- **pickedTimeTo**: Type: date-time┃null, Description: End of the pickup time window, selected from available time intervals provided by the method that returns available time slots, Constraints: Pattern: ^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$.
    

#### Response

- **id**: Type: integer, Description: Unique identifier for the pickup request, Constraints: Minimum 1.
    
- **number**: Type: string, Description: Reference number for the pickup request, Constraints: Pattern: '^\[A-Z\]{4}\\d{10}$'.
    
- **status**: Type: string, Description: Current pickup status, Constraints: Possible values include: Draft, Created, AppointedCourier, InProgress, Done, ClientCanceled, NotCompleted, Deleted, ReceivedByCourier.
    
- **statusDateTime**: Type: string, Format: date-time, Description: Date and time when the status was last updated, Constraints: Pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$".
    
- **source**: Type: string, Description: Origin of the request, Constraints: Max length 50.
    
- **executor**: Type: string, Description: Assigned executor for the pickup, Constraints: Max length 50, Nullable.
    
- **companyTin**: Type: string, Description: The contract number of the requesting company, Constraints: Min length 2, Max length 20.
    
- **companyName**: Type: string, Description: Name of the company, Constraints: Min length 2, Max length 255.
    
- **fullName**: Type: string, Description: Full name of the requester, Constraints: Max length 100.
    
- **phone**: Type: string, Description: Contact phone number, Constraints: Min length 8, Max length 14.
    
- **email**: Type: string, Description: Contact email address, Constraints: Nullable.
    
- **countryCode**: Type: string, Description: Country code for the pickup location, Constraints: Pattern: "^\[A-Z\]{2}$".
    
- **createdByUser**: Type: string, Description: ID of the user who created the request, Constraints: Max length 50.
    
- **deliveryPartner**: Type: string, Description: Partner responsible for delivery, Constraints: Nullable.
    
- **lockVersion**: Type: integer, Description: Version number for concurrency control, Constraints: Minimum 1.
    
- **divisionId**: Type: integer, Description: Division ID associated with the pickup, Constraints: Minimum 1, Nullable.
    
- **settlementId**: Type: integer, Description: Settlement ID for the pickup location, Constraints: Minimum 1.
    
- **cityDistrict**: Type: string, Description: City district of the pickup location, Constraints: Max length 50, Nullable.
    
- **address**: Type: object, Description: Formatted address and geolocation, Constraints: Nullable.
    
    - **string**: Type: string, Description: Complete address as a formatted string, Constraints: Max length 255.
        
    - **latitude**: Type: number, Format: float, Description: Latitude of the pickup location, Constraints: Minimum -90, Maximum 90.
        
    - **longitude**: Type: number, Format: float, Description: Longitude of the pickup location, Constraints: Minimum -180, Maximum 180.
        
- **addressParts**: Type: object, Description: Breakdown of address details, Constraints: Nullable.
    
    - **postCode**: Type: string, Description: Postal code of the pickup location, Constraints: Max length 10.
        
    - **building**: Type: string, Description: Building number of the pickup location, Constraints: Max length 100.
        
    - **street**: Type: string, Description: Street name for the pickup location, Constraints: Max length 100.
        
    - **city**: Type: string, Description: City name for the pickup location, Constraints: Max length 100.
        
    - **region**: Type: string, Description: Region name for the pickup location, Constraints: Max length 100.
        
    - **flat**: Type: string, Description: Flat or apartment number, Constraints: Max length 10.
        
    - **note**: Type: string, Description: Additional notes for the address, Constraints: Max length 100.
        
    - **block**: Type: string, Description: Block or building section, Constraints: Max length 100, Nullable.
        
- **pickedTimeFrom**: Type: string, Format: date-time, Description: Start of the pickup time window, Constraints: Nullable.
    
- **pickedTimeTo**: Type: string, Format: date-time, Description: End time for the pickup window, Constraints: Nullable.
    
- **note**: Type: string, Description: Note or instructions for the courier, Constraints: Max length 255, Nullable.
    
- **currencyCode**: Type: string, Description: Currency code of the country used for payment transactions, Constraints: Pattern: "^\[A-Z\]{3}$".
    
- **externalId**: Type: string, Description: Internal data, not for use, Constraints: Nullable.
    
- **shipments**: Type: array, Items: type: object, Description: List of shipments associated with this pickup request.
    
- **services**: Type: array, Items: type: object, Description: List of additional services that can be included in the pickup request, Constraints: Currently under development.
    
- **statuses**: Type: array, Description: Array of status objects tracking pickup status changes, Items: type: object.
    
    - **id**: Type: integer, Description: Unique status identifier, Constraints: Minimum 1.
        
    - **pickupId**: Type: integer, Description: Pickup request ID, Constraints: Minimum 1.
        
    - **status**: Type: string, Description: Current pickup status, Constraints: Possible values include: Draft, Created, AppointedCourier, InProgress, Done, ClientCanceled, NotCompleted, Deleted, ReceivedByCourier.
        
    - **dateTime**: Type: string, Format: date-time, Description: Date and time of status update, Constraints: Pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$".
        
    - **note**: Type: string, Description: Optional notes related to the status, Constraints: Max length 255, Nullable.
        
    - **user**: Type: string, Description: User ID who changed the status, Constraints: Max length 50.
        
    - **createdAt**: Type: string, Format: date-time, Description: Date-time of status creation, Constraints: Pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$".
        
    - **updatedAt**: Type: string, Format: date-time, Description: Date-time of the last update, Constraints: Pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$".
        
    - **deletedAt**: Type: string, Format: date-time, Description: Date-time of delete, Constraints: Pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$", Nullable.
        
- **createdAt**: Type: string, Format: date-time, Description: Date-time of pickup creation, Constraints: Pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$".
    
- **updatedAt**: Type: string, Format: date-time, Description: Date-time of the last update, Constraints: Pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$".
    
- **deletedAt**: Type: string, Format: date-time, Description: Date-time of delete, Constraints: Pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$", Nullable.
    

The response for this request can be represented as a JSON schema.

request.description:
# Retrieve Pickup Information

This method allows business clients to retrieve a list of all courier pickup requests they have created. Clients can filter the list using specific parameters such as pickup IDs or pickup numbers. This method is available to business clients in EU countries where Nova Post operates.

### Request Body

- **name**: 'numbers\[\]', **description**: Search pickups by document number. Can accept either a single search number or an array of numbers for conducting the search., **type**: string, **example**: PUCZ0000002671
    
- **name**: 'ids\[\]', **description**: A list of pickup request IDs to search. Can accept either a single search number or an array of numbers for conducting the search., **type**: integer, **format**: int32, **example**: 28813
    
- **name**: 'limit', **description**: Max number of items to return on page., **type**: integer, **format**: int32, **example**: 1, **default**: 15
    
- **name**: 'page', **description**: Number of page to return., **type**: integer, **format**: int32, **example**: 1
    

### Response

- **current_page**: The current page of results in the paginated response., **type**: integer, **minimum**: 1
    
- **last_page**: The last available page in the paginated response., **type**: integer, **minimum**: 1
    
- **per_page**: The number of items per page., **type**: integer, **minimum**: 1
    
- **total**: Total number of pickup requests matching the filter criteria., **type**: integer, **minimum**: 0
    
- **items**: List of pickup requests., **type**: array
    
    - **id**: Unique identifier for the pickup request., **type**: string, **minimum**: 1
        
    - **number**: Reference number for the pickup request., **type**: string, **pattern**: '^\[A-Z\]{4}\\d{10}$'
        
    - **status**: Current pickup status, representing the different stages in the pickup process., **type**: string
        
    - **statusDateTime**: Date-time of the last status update., **type**: string, **format**: date-time, **pattern**: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$"
        
    - **source**: Source of the request creation (e.g., API, Web)., **type**: string
        
    - **executor**: Identifier of the executor (courier or service)., **type**: string
        
    - **companyTin**: Tax identification number of the company., **type**: string
        
    - **companyName**: Name of the company creating the request., **type**: string
        
    - **fullName**: Full name of the client sending the parcel., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 100
        
    - **phone**: The contact phone number of the sender., **type**: string, **minLength**: 8, **maxLength**: 14
        
    - **email**: Contact email address, if applicable., **type**: string, **nullable**: true
        
    - **countryCode**: ISO Alpha-2 code for the pickup location., **type**: string, **pattern**: "^\[A-Z\]{2}$"
        
    - **externalId**: External identifier of the pickup request provided by the client., **type**: string
        
    - **createdByUser**: User ID of the person who created the request., **type**: string
        
    - **divisionId**: Division ID responsible for handling the request., **type**: integer
        
    - **settlementId**: Settlement ID for the pickup location., **type**: integer
        
    - **cityDistrict**: District of the city for the pickup., **type**: string
        
    - **deliveryPartner**: Delivery partner handling the request., **type**: string
        
    - **lockVersion**: Version control number for preventing conflicts during updates., **type**: integer
        
    - **address**: Full address details., **type**: object
        
        - **address**: Full formatted address., **type**: string
            
        - **latitude**: Latitude coordinate of the pickup location., **type**: string
            
        - **longitude**: Longitude coordinate of the pickup location., **type**: string
            
    - **addressParts**: Breakdown of address details., **type**: object
        
        - **postCode**: Postal code of the pickup location., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 10
            
        - **building**: Building number of the pickup location., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 100
            
        - **street**: Street name for the pickup location., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 100
            
        - **city**: City name for the pickup location., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 100
            
        - **region**: Region name for the pickup location., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 100
            
        - **flat**: Flat or apartment number., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 10
            
        - **note**: Additional notes for the address., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 100
            
        - **block**: Block or building section., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 100, **nullable**: true
            
    - **pickedTimeFrom**: Start of the pickup time window, specified in request., **type**: string, **format**: date-time, **pattern**: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$", **nullable**: true
        
    - **pickedTimeTo**: End time for the pickup window, specified in request., **type**: string, **format**: date-time, **pattern**: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$", **nullable**: true
        
    - **currencyCode**: Currency code of the country used for payment transactions., **type**: string, **pattern**: "^\[A-Z\]{3}$"
        
    - **shipments**: List of shipments associated with this pickup request., **type**: array
        
    - **services**: List of additional services requested., **type**: array
        
    - **statuses**: Array of status objects tracking pickup status changes., **type**: array
        
        - **id**: Unique status identifier., **type**: integer, **minimum**: 1
            
        - **pickupId**: Pickup request ID., **type**: integer, **minimum**: 1
            
        - **status**: Current pickup status, representing the different stages in the pickup process., **type**: string
            
        - **dateTime**: Date and time of status update., **type**: string, **format**: date-time, **pattern**: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$"
            
        - **note**: Optional notes related to the status., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 255, **nullable**: true
            
        - **user**: User ID who changed the status., **type**: string, **maxLength**: 50
            
        - **createdAt**: Date-time of status creation., **type**: string, **format**: date-time, **pattern**: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$"
            
        - **updatedAt**: Date-time of the last update., **type**: string, **format**: date-time, **pattern**: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$"
            
        - **deletedAt**: Date-time of delete, if applicable., **type**: string, **format**: date-time, **pattern**: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$", **nullable**: true

    - **updatedAt**: Date-time when the pickup request was last updated., **type**: string, **format**: date-time
        
    - **deletedAt**: Date-time when the pickup request was deleted, if applicable., **type**: string, **format**: date-time, **nullable**: true

request.description:
## Update a courier pickup request

The method is used to update the details of an already created pickup request. It allows clients to modify information such as the pickup address, contact details, time window and other to ensure accurate and timely parcel collection. This method is available to business clients in EU countries where Nova Post operates.

#### Request Body

- **note**: Optional notes or instructions for the courier. (maxLength: 255)
    
- **services**: List of additional services that can be included in the pickup request. This functionality is currently under development. (nullable)
    
- **phone**: The contact phone number of the sender, required to allow the courier to reach out if necessary. (minLength: 8, maxLength: 14)
    
- **email**: While not mandatory, providing an email is recommended as a backup contact method in case the phone number is incorrect or for additional notifications regarding the pickup. (nullable)
    
- **fullName**: Full name of the client sending the parcel, essential for identifying the sender and ensuring accurate handling of the pickup. (maxLength: 100)
    
- **companyTin**: The contract number of the requesting company. (minLength: 2, maxLength: 20)
    
- **companyName**: Name of the company requesting the pickup. (minLength: 2, maxLength: 255)
    
- **lockVersion**: Version number for concurrency control to avoid conflicting updates. When using this method and making updates, the value of this parameter must be incremented by 1 for each subsequent change. (minimum: 1)
    
- **countryCode**: ISO Alpha-2 code for the pickup location. (pattern: "^\[A-Z\]{2}$")
    
- **addressParts**: Detailed address information for the pickup location.
    
    - **city**: The name of the city for the pickup location. (maxLength: 100)
        
    - **region**: The administrative area, state, or region for the pickup. (maxLength: 100)
        
    - **street**: The street name for the pickup location. (maxLength: 100)
        
    - **postCode**: The postal code of the pickup location. (maxLength: 10)
        
    - **building**: The building number or name at the pickup address. (maxLength: 100)
        
    - **flat**: The apartment or office number within the building. (maxLength: 10)
        
    - **block**: The specific block or section within a larger complex, if applicable. (maxLength: 100)
        
    - **note**: Additional instructions for the courier to access the pickup location. (maxLength: 100)
        
- **pickedTimeFrom**: Start of the pickup time window, selected from available time intervals provided by the method that returns available time slots. (format: date-time, pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$", nullable)
    
- **pickedTimeTo**: End of the pickup time window, selected from available time intervals provided by the method that returns available time slots. (format: date-time, pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$", nullable)
    

#### Response

The response for this request includes a JSON schema with:

- **id**: Unique identifier for the updated pickup request. (minimum: 1)
    
- **number**: Reference number for the pickup request. (pattern: '^\[A-Z\]{4}\\d{10}$')
    
- **status**: Current pickup status, representing the different stages in the pickup process. Possible values include: Draft, Created, AppointedCourier, InProgress, Done, ClientCanceled, NotCompleted, Deleted, ReceivedByCourier.
    
- **lockVersion**: Updated version number for concurrency control.
    
- **note**: Updated notes for the courier. (maxLength: 255)
    
- **pickedTimeFrom**: Updated start of the pickup time window. (format: date-time, pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$")
    
- **pickedTimeTo**: Updated end of the pickup time window. (format: date-time, pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$")
    
- **addressParts**: Updated address information for the pickup location.
    
    - **city**: The name of the city for the pickup location. (maxLength: 100)
        
    - **region**: The administrative area, state, or region for the pickup. (maxLength: 100)
        
    - **street**: The street name for the pickup location. (maxLength: 100)
        
    - **postCode**: The postal code of the pickup location. (maxLength: 10)
        
    - **building**: The building number or name at the pickup address. (maxLength: 100)
        
    - **flat**: The apartment or office number within the building. (maxLength: 10)
        
    - **block**: The specific block or section within a larger complex, if applicable. (maxLength: 100)
        
    - **note**: Additional instructions for the courier to access the pickup location. (maxLength: 100)
        
- **statuses**: Array of updated status objects tracking pickup status changes. (items: object)

request.description:
## Delete a courier pickup request

This method allows business clients to fully delete an existing courier pickup request. When a pickup request is deleted, it is marked as removed in the system, and the deletion date-time is recorded. This method is available to business clients in EU countries where Nova Post operates.

#### Request

- **in**: path
    
- **name**: id
    
- **required**: true
    
- **schema**: type: integer, minimum: 1
    
- **description**: Unique identifier of the pickup request to be deleted.
    

#### Response

- **deletedAt**: type: string, format: date-time, description: The date-time when the pickup request was marked as deleted, pattern: "^20\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}-\[0-9\]{2}T\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}:\[0-9\]{2}.\[0-9\]{6}Z$"

request.description:
## Retrieve time intervals for pickup

This method retrieves available time intervals for pickups. The algorithm operates based on geographical zones serviced by couriers. These zones are conditional areas on a map defined by logistical features of courier operations. Depending on the pickup location, the system identifies the specific courier responsible for that zone and returns the detailed time intervals available for pickup.

**Mandatory Parameters:**

- `countryCode`: Specifies the country code according to ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 standard.
    
- `type`: Defines the type of pickup. Allowed values are `PickupDayToDay` (same-day pickup) or `PickupNextDay` (next-day pickup).
    

If only these two parameters are provided, the method will return general courier working hours for the specified country without detailed intervals for a specific location or zone.

**Recommended Parameters for Accurate Results:**

- `addressParts`: Provide the full pickup address, including building, street, city, region, and postal code. This ensures precise time intervals are returned for the specified address.
    
- `latitude` and `longitude`: Use geographical coordinates if a full address is not available to determine the zone.
    
- `divisionId`: Specify the ID of the nearest division if the exact address is unknown. However, note that proximity to a division does not guarantee that the courier servicing the address operates from the same division.
    

**Additional Parameters:**

- `weight`: Time intervals may depend on the shipment's weight. This parameter is helpful for large or weight-sensitive shipments.
    

**Important Notes:**

1. If only `countryCode` and `type` are provided, the system will return general working hours of couriers without detailed time intervals for a specific address.
    
2. For the most accurate time intervals, providing a full address or coordinates is strongly recommended.
    

**Time Interval Selection Logic:**

- If a `PickupDayToDay` configuration exists:
    
    - It takes priority over PickupNextDay.
        
    - Today is available if:
        
        - Not a holiday (`holiday == false`);
            
        - A working schedule exists (`from != null`);
            
        - Current time < `orderTo`.
            
    - Up to 7 calendar days (including today) may be returned if:
        
        - Not holidays;
            
        - `from` is set;
            
        - `orderTo` is only checked for today.
            
- If no `PickupDayToDay`, but `PickupNextDay` is configured:
    
    - Today is not available.
        
    - Up to 7 calendar days (excluding today) may be returned if:
        
        - Not holidays;
            
        - `from` is set.
            
    - `orderTo` applies **only to tomorrow**. If current time > `orderTo`, tomorrow is excluded.
        
- If no time interval configuration exists (fallback mode):
    
    - Today is not available.
        
    - Up to 7 calendar days (excluding today, weekends, holidays) may be returned.
        
    - A fixed `orderTo = 17:00` applies only to tomorrow.
        

**Note:**  
If `from` is set but `timeIntervals` is empty, the courier will arrive **sometime during the day** without a fixed slot.  
This logic applies **to all types** of configurations.

**Validation behavior:**

- If the selected day is no longer valid, the system automatically assigns the next available valid day.
    
- If the time interval is invalid or empty, the courier will arrive during the full working period.
    

**Recommendation:**  
Providing full address details or coordinates is strongly recommended to ensure accurate time interval results.

#### Request Body

- **type**: { **type**: string, **description**: "Type of time interval. Allowed values are `PickupDayToDay` or `PickupNextDay`", **enum**: \["PickupDayToDay", "PickupNextDay"\] }
    
- **countryCode**: { **type**: string, **description**: "Country code according to the ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 standard", **pattern**: "^\[A-Z\]{2}$" }
    
- **divisionId**: { **type**: integer, **description**: "Division ID for specific branch identification", **minimum**: 1, **nullable**: true }
    
- **latitude**: { **type**: number, **description**: "Latitude for geolocation-based search", **minimum**: -90, **maximum**: 90, **nullable**: true }
    
- **longitude**: { **type**: number, **description**: "Longitude for geolocation-based search", **minimum**: -180, **maximum**: 180, **nullable**: true }
    
- **maxWeightPlaceRecipient**: { **type**: integer, **description**: "Weight of the shipment in kilograms. Optional for non-weight-sensitive intervals", **minimum**: 0, **nullable**: true }
    
- **addressParts**: { **type**: object, **description**: "Full address details for location-based interval search. If not provided, latitude and longitude will be used", **nullable**: true, **properties**: { **building**: { **type**: string, **description**: "Building number or identifier", **maxLength**: 100 }, **street**: { **type**: string, **description**: "Street name", **maxLength**: 100 }, **city**: { **type**: string, **description**: "City name", **maxLength**: 100 }, **region**: { **type**: string, **description**: "Region or administrative area", **maxLength**: 100 }, **postCode**: { **type**: string, **description**: "Postal code", **maxLength**: 10 }, **flat**: { **type**: string, **description**: "Flat or apartment number, if applicable", **maxLength**: 10, **nullable**: true }, **note**: { **type**: string, **description**: "Additional notes for location identification", **maxLength**: 100, **nullable**: true } } }
    

#### Response

- **id**: integer, Unique identifier for the time interval, minimum: 1
    
- **countryCode**: string, Country code according to the ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 standard, pattern: "^\[A-Z\]{2}$"
    
- **divisionId**: integer, Division ID related to the time interval, minimum: 1, nullable: true
    
- **type**: string, The type of the time interval, enum: - PickupDayToDay, - PickupNextDay
    
- **deliveryPartner**: string, Partner responsible for the pickup, nullable: true
    
- **ignoreNonWorkingDays**: boolean, Whether to include non-working days in the search
    
- **monday**: object, Time intervals available on Monday, properties:
    
    - **from**: string, Start time of the interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
        
    - **to**: string, End time of the interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
        
    - **orderTo**: string, Time until which an order can be placed for the interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
        
    - **timeIntervals**: array, items:
        
        - **from**: string, Start time of the sub-interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
            
        - **to**: string, End time of the sub-interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
            
        - **orderTo**: string, Time until which an order can be placed for the sub-interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
            
- **tuesday**: object, Time intervals available on Tuesday, properties:
    
    - **from**: string, Start time of the interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true

        - **to**: string, End time of the sub-interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
            
        - **orderTo**: string, Time until which an order can be placed for the sub-interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
            
- **saturday**: object, Time intervals available on Saturday, properties:
    
    - **from**: string, Start time of the interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable
        

- **sunday**: object, Time intervals available on Sunday, properties:
    
    - **from**: string, Start time of the interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
        
    - **to**: string, End time of the interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
        
    - **orderTo**: string, Time until which an order can be placed for the interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
        
    - **timeIntervals**: array, items:
        
        - **from**: string, Start time of the sub-interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
            
        - **to**: string, End time of the sub-interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
            
        - **orderTo**: string, Time until which an order can be placed for the sub-interval, pattern: "^((\[0,1\]\[0-9\]|(2\[0-3\]))|(\[0-9\])):\[0-5\]\[0-9\]$", nullable: true
            
- **nonWorkingDays**: array, List of non-working days in the week, items: string, enum: - Monday, - Tuesday, - Wednesday, - Thursday, - Friday, - Saturday, - Sunday
    

- **createdAt**: string, Date and time when the entry was created, format: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ"
    
- **updatedAt**: string, Date and time when the entry was last updated, format: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ"
    
- **deletedAt**: string, Date and time when the entry was deleted, format: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ", nullable: true
    
- **isDeleted**: boolean, Indicates whether the entry has been deleted, default: false

item.description:
# Registration of sending parcels from your sender's address

The Courier pickup feature allows sending parcels directly from an address. Through the API, clients can create requests for courier pickup, manage visit time intervals, cancel, and edit requests.

This article outlines the key aspects of working with courier pickup through the API.

Folder contains following methods with path configured for <u>Stage Environment</u>:

[https://api-stage.novapost.pl/v.1.0](https://api-stage.novapost.pl/v.1.0)

## Courier pickup methods in API:

- Create a courier call request
    
- Add parcels to a courier call request
    
- Change the status of a request
    
- Retrieve available time intervals for a courier visit
    
- Retrieve a list of parcels added to a courier call request
    
- Remove parcels from a request
    
- Delete a courier call request
    
- Track the status of current courier call requests

item.name: Webhooks

request.description:
**Create subscription**  
Method: POST  
Path: `/v.1.0/tracking-push/subscribers`  
Auth: `Authorization: {jwt}`  
Overview: Create a webhook subscription to receive tracking events.  
Query parameters:

- type: required; type: string. The type of subscription to be created. This is a mandatory field and can take values such as: - **individual**: For personal accounts. - **numbers**: For tracking specific shipment numbers. - **legal**: For business accounts, requiring additional company details. Allowed: individual, numbers, legal
    
- url: required; type: string (uri). The callback URL where webhook notifications will be sent. This is a mandatory field and must be a valid URL. The URL should be capable of receiving POST requests with JSON payloads.
    
- isActive: required; type: boolean. Indicates whether the subscription should be active immediately upon creation. If set to `true`, the webhook will start sending notifications as soon as the subscription is confirmed. Defaults to `false` if not provided.
    
- phone: optional; type: string. The phone number associated with the subscription. This parameter is required when the subscription type is `individual`. The phone number must be in international format, for example, 380637445555.
    
- secretToken: optional; type: string. Webhook Authorization Token: Maximum Length 600 Characters
    
- eventTypes: optional; type: array. A list of event types that the subscription will listen to. This parameter allows you to specify which events should trigger webhook notifications. If no value is provided, the subscription will be created for all event types by default.
    
- sendWarnings: optional; type: boolean. Determines if email warnings should be sent in case of issues with the specified webhook URL. If enabled, the system will send notifications about delivery problems or other errors. Defaults to `false`.
    
- warningEmail: optional; type: string (email). The email address where warnings about endpoint issues will be sent. It is required if `sendWarnings` is set to `true`. The email address should be valid and active to ensure delivery of warnings.
    
- companyTins: optional; type: array. A list of company tax identification numbers relevant to the subscription type `legal`. This parameter is essential for legal subscriptions to verify the company's identity. Each TIN should be a valid UUID.  
    Notes:
    
- The `type` defines required attributes: `individual`→`phone`, `numbers`→use `/subscribers/{id}/numbers`, `legal`→`companyTins[]`.
    
- Empty `eventTypes[]` = all events.
    
- `sendWarnings` with `warningEmail` enables non-delivery alerts.  
    Success: 201. Response fields: `id, type, secretToken, url, is_active, phone, cid, event_types, send_warnings, warning_email, company_tins, updated_at, created_at`.  
    Example:
    
    ``` json
    {
    "url": "https://example.com/webhooks/np",
    "type": "numbers",
    "isActive": true,
    "eventTypes": [],
    "sendWarnings": true,
    "warningEmail": "alerts@example.com",
    "secretToken": "replace-with-your-token"
    }
    
     ```

**Retrieve subscriptions**
Method: GET
Path: `/v.1.0/tracking-push/subscribers`
Auth: `Authorization: {jwt}`
Overview: Return all subscriptions configured for the authenticated client.
Success: 200.

**Update subscription**  
Method: PUT  
Path: `/v.1.0/tracking-push/subscribers/{id}`  
Auth: `Authorization: {jwt}`  
Path parameter:

- { "url": "https://example.com/webhooks/np-updated", "isActive": true, "eventTypes": \["createShipment","inTransit","delivered"\], "sendWarnings": false, "warningEmail": null }

**Delete subscription**
Method: DELETE
Path: `/v.1.0/tracking-push/subscribers/{id}`
Auth: `Authorization: {jwt}`
Path parameter:
- id: required; type: string. The unique identifier of the subscription to be deleted. This is a required path parameter that identifies the specific subscription you wish to remove.
Outcome: 204 on success. Deletion is irreversible.

**Add numbers to subscription**
Method: POST
Path: `/v.1.0/tracking-push/subscribers/{id}/numbers`
Auth: `Authorization: {jwt}`
Path parameter:
- id: required; type: string. The unique identifier of the subscription to which shipment numbers will be added. This is a required path parameter.
Body:
```json
{
  "numbers": ["20600000179995", "20600000179992"]
}
```
Success: 200.

item.description:
## Webhooks

Subscribe to tracking events and receive HTTP POST callbacks on your endpoint.  
Base path: `/v.1.0/tracking-push/subscribers`. Auth header: `Authorization: {{jwt}}`.  
Types:

- `numbers` - events for a specific list of shipments
    
- `individual` - events for shipments created by a specific person (identified by phone)
    
- `legal` - events for shipments of specified companies (by TIN/EDRPOU)  
    Key fields:
    
- `url` - HTTPS callback endpoint
    
- `secretToken` - optional signing token (sent in `X-NP-Key`)
    
- `eventTypes[]` - filter of events (empty = all)
    
- `isActive` - subscription status
    
- `sendWarnings` / `warningEmail` - email alerts when delivery fails

item.name: Registers

request.description:
## Endpoint Description

This endpoint allows users to register a new shipment in the system. It processes the provided shipment details and returns information about the newly created shipment record.

**Limitations for working with registers:**

1. This method is available for shipments from Ukraine to the World.
    
2. Creating registers is available only for shipments originating from Ukraine.
    
3. A shipment can be added to a register only if the Sender’s data (city, counterparty, address) are identical for all shipments being added.
    
4. A shipment can be added only to one register — the same document cannot be added to multiple registers simultaneously.
    
5. A shipment cannot be added to a register if a printed form has already been generated for this document and the shipment date (printing date) is earlier than yesterday relative to the register creation date.
    
6. A shipment can be added to a register only until an express waybill has been created based on it (or until the shipment has been scanned at a Nova Poshta branch/unit).
    
7. A shipment marked for deletion cannot be added to a register.
    
8. After the register’s printed form has been generated, adding shipments to it is blocked.
    

## Request Format

### Request

- **Method**: `POST`
    
- **URL**: `https://api-stage.novapost.com/v.1.0/registry/`
    

##### Query Parameters:

- **description** (string): Register name.
    
- **shipments** (array of strings): An array containing unique shipment identifiers.
    

#### Example Request Body

``` json
{
    "description": "Test",
    "shipments": [
        "3a56b790-a362-11f0-87c4-005056bd9e02",
        "47fc8621-a362-11f0-87c4-005056bd9e02"
    ]
}

 ```

## Response Format

### Response Status

- **200 OK**: Indicates that the shipment has been successfully registered.
    

### Response Body

The response body must contain the following parameters:

- **id** (string): Unique registry identifier.
    
- **number** (string): Registry number.
    
- **versionTracking** (integer): Registry version.
    
- **createdAt** (date-time): Registry creation date.
    
- **updatedAt** (string|null): Registry last update date.
    
- **deletedAt** (string|null): Registry deletion date.
    
- **posted** (boolean): Flag: 0 - registry not printed, 1 - printed.
    
- **printed** (boolean): Flag: 0 - registry not printed, 1 - printed.
    
- **description** (string): Registry name.
    
- **senderCompanyId** (string): Unique identifier of the sender’s legal entity in the system.
    
- **senderCompanyTin** (string): Sender legal entity identifier.
    
- **senderPhone** (string): Sender contact phone number.
    
- **senderCountryCode** (string): Sender's country code according to ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2.
    
- **senderSettlementId** (string): Unique settlement identifier.
    
- **senderSettlementExternalId** (string): Additional unique settlement identifier (Ukraine only).
    
- **senderSettlementName** (string): Settlement name.
    
- **senderDivisionId** (string): Unique warehouse identifier.
    
- **senderDivisionExternalId** (string): Additional unique warehouse identifier (Ukraine only).
    
- **senderDivisionName** (string): Warehouse name.
    
- **senderAddress** (string): Home address or warehouse description.
    
- **senderAddressParts** (object): Sender’s address — contains variables describing the sender’s pickup address or another location besides warehouses.
    
    - **city** (string): City name from which the shipment is dispatched.
        
    - **region** (string): Administrative region (state or province) of the city.
        
    - **street** (string): Street name of the sender’s location.
        
    - **streetId** (string): Unique street identifier.
        
    - **postCode** (string): Postal code.
        
    - **building** (string): Building number.
        
    - **flat** (string): Apartment number.
        
    - **block** (string): Block.
        
    - **latitude** (number|null): Geographic latitude.
        
    - **longitude** (number|null): Geographic longitude.
        
    - **note** (string): Additional information about the sender’s address.
        
    - **addressId** (string|null): Unique address identifier.
        
- **shipments** (array of object): List of shipments included in the register ⮕ \[ Item \].
    
    - **shipmentId** (string): Unique shipment identifier.
        
    - **shipmentNumber** (string): Shipment number.
        

#### Example Response Body

``` json
{
    "id": "55d8598f-a362-11f0-87c4-005056bd9e02",
    "number": "106-00000749",
    "versionTracking": 1,
    "createdAt": "2025-10-07 12:45:19.085311",
    "updatedAt": null,
    "deletedAt": null,
    "posted": false,
    "printed": false,
    "description": "Test",
    "senderCompanyId": "208a60fa-45fc-48ef-98e5-53f0819ebf4f",
    "senderCompanyTin": "",
    "senderPhone": "380954891992",
    "senderCountryCode": "UA",
    "senderSettlementId": "118064",
    "senderSettlementExternalId": "e718a680-4b33-11e4-ab6d-005056801329",
    "senderSettlementName": "Kyiv",
    "senderDivisionId": "12255",
    "senderDivisionExternalId": "abe2e27a-79c2-11e2-b1c0-d4ae527baec3",
    "senderDivisionName": "",
    "senderAddress": "Київ, Відділення №72 (до 30 кг): вул. Бульварно-Кудрявська, 21",
    "senderAddressParts": {
        "city": "",
        "region": "",
        "street": "",
        "streetId": "",
        "postCode": "",
        "building": "",
        "flat": "",
        "block": "",
        "latitude": null,
        "longitude": null,
        "note": "",
        "addressId": null
    },
    "shipments": [
        {
            "shipmentId": "47fc8621-a362-11f0-87c4-005056bd9e02",
            "shipmentNumber": "51187918711526"
        },
        {
            "shipmentId": "3a56b790-a362-11f0-87c4-005056bd9e02",
            "shipmentNumber": "51262070458910"
        }
    ]
}

 ```

## Endpoint Description

StartFragmentThis API method allows retrieving information about registries created by you.EndFragment

### Request Format

### Request

- **Method**: GET
    
- **URL**: `https://api-stage.novapost.com/v.1.0/registry/`
    

**Path Parameter**:

- **ids\[\]** (array of string): Unique registry identifiers for which information should be retrieved. This parameter is required if the `numbers` parameter is not specified.
    
- **numbers\[\]** (array of string): Unique registry number for which information should be retrieved. This parameter is required if the `ids` parameter is not specified.EndFragment
    
- **settlementIds\[\]** (array of string): Unique settlement identifier.
    
- **createdAtFrom** (date): Start date of the registry filtering period. Used to retrieve records created from this date onwards (inclusive). The `createdAtFrom` field must be a date before `createdAtTo`
    
- **createdAtTo** (date): End date of the registry filtering period. Used to retrieve records created before this date (exclusive).
    
- **pageEnd** (integer): Max number of items to return on page.
    
- **limit** (integer): Number of page to return.
    

## Response Format

### Response Status

- **200 OK**: Indicates that the shipment has been successfully registered.
    

### Response Body

The response body must contain the following parameters:

- **current_page** (integer): Current page number in the response.
    
- **last_page** (integer): Total number of pages available for the request.
    
- **per_page** (integer): Number of items returned on a single page.
    
- **total** (integer): Total number of items matching the request criteria.
    
- **items** (integer): Array of objects containing data of the items on the current page. Each item includes:
    
    - **id** (string): Unique registry identifier.
        
    - **number** (string): Registry number.
        
    - **versionTracking** (integer): Registry version.
        
    - **createdAt** (date-time): Registry creation date.
        
    - **updatedAt** (string|null): Registry last update date.
        
    - **deletedAt** (string|null): Registry deletion date.
        
    - **posted** (boolean): Flag: 0 - registry not printed, 1 - printed.
        
    - **printed** (boolean): Flag: 0 - registry not printed, 1 - printed.
        
    - **description** (string): Registry name.
        
    - **senderCompanyId** (string): Unique identifier of the sender’s legal entity in the system.
        
    - **senderCompanyTin** (string): Sender legal entity identifier.
        
    - **senderPhone** (string): Sender contact phone number.
        
    - **senderCountryCode** (string): Sender's country code according to ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2.
        
    - **senderSettlementId** (string): Unique settlement identifier.
        
    - **senderSettlementExternalId** (string): Additional unique settlement identifier (Ukraine only).
        
    - **senderSettlementName** (string): Settlement name.
        
    - **senderDivisionId** (string): Unique warehouse identifier.
        
    - **senderDivisionExternalId** (string): Additional unique warehouse identifier (Ukraine only).
        
    - **senderDivisionName** (string): Warehouse name.
        
    - **senderAddress** (string): Home address or warehouse description.
        
    - **senderAddressParts** (object): Sender’s address — contains variables describing the sender’s pickup address or another location besides warehouses.
        
        - **city** (string): City name from which the shipment is dispatched.
            
        - **region** (string): Administrative region (state or province) of the city.
            
        - **street** (string): Street name of the sender’s location.
            
        - **streetId** (string): Unique street identifier.
            
        - **postCode** (string): Postal code.
            
        - **building** (string): Building number.
            
        - **flat** (string): Apartment number.
            
        - **block** (string): Block.
            
        - **latitude** (number|null): Geographic latitude.
            
        - **longitude** (number|null): Geographic longitude.
            
        - **note** (string): Additional information about the sender’s address.
            
        - **addressId** (string|null): Unique address identifier.
            
    - **shipments** (array of object): List of shipments included in the register ⮕ \[ Item \].
        
        - **shipmentId** (string): Unique shipment identifier.
            
        - **shipmentNumber** (string): Shipment number.
            

### Example Response

request.description:
## Endpoint Description

This method is used to add already created shipments to an existing registry identified by {{Id}}.

Restrictions

1. This method is available for shipments from Ukraine to the World.
    
2. A shipment can be added to a registry only if the Sender’s data (city, counterparty, address) are identical to the shipments already included in the registry.
    
3. A shipment can be added only to one register - the same document cannot be added to multiple registers simultaneously.
    
4. A shipment cannot be added to a register if a printed form has already been generated for this document and the shipment date (printing date) is earlier than yesterday relative to the register creation date.
    
5. A shipment can be added to a register only until an express waybill has been created based on it (or until the shipment has been scanned at a Nova Poshta branch/unit).
    
6. A shipment marked for deletion cannot be added to a register.
    
7. After the register’s printed form has been generated, adding shipments to it is blocked.
    

### Request Format

### Request

- **Method**: `POST`
    
- **URL**: `https://api-stage.novapost.com/v.1.0/registry/{{Id}}/shipments`
    

**Path Parameter**:

- **{Id}** (string): Unique register identifier to which the shipment will be added.
    

##### Query Parameters:

- **shipments** (array of object): Array of unique shipment identifiers to be added to the registry. Min Items: 1
    

#### Example Request Body

``` json
{
  "shipments": [
    "4e8a6cc9-a36b-11f0-87c4-005056bd9e02"
  ]
}

 ```

## Response Format

### Response Status

- **200 OK**: Indicates that the shipment has been successfully registered.

request.description:
## Endpoint Description

This method allows you to permanently delete an existing register identified by {{Id}}.

### Request Format

### Request

- **Method**: `DELETE`
    
- **URL**:`https://api-stage.novapost.com/v.1.0/registry/{{Id}}`
    

**Path Parameter**:

- **{Id}** (string): Unique register identifier to be deleted.
    

### Response Status

- **200 OK**: Indicates that the shipment has been successfully registered.
    

### Response Body

The response body must contain the following parameters:

- `success` (boolean): Indicates whether the deletion was successful. A value of `true` confirms that the entry has been successfully removed.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "success": true
}

 ```

item.description:
The Registry feature allows grouping shipments into separate lists (registries) for easier control and processing. Through the API you can create new registries, add or remove shipments, rename, and fully delete them.  
  
Folder contains following methods with path configured for Stage Environment:  
[https://api-stage.novapost.pl/](https://api-stage.novapost.pl/)

**Registry methods in API:**

- **Retrieve a list of registries** — view all existing registries with filtering options (`GET /registry`).
    
- **Create a registry** — register a new shipment registry with a chosen name/description (`POST /registry`).
    
- **Add shipments to a registry** — attach one or more shipments to an existing registry (`POST /registry/{id}/shipments`).
    
- **Remove shipments from a registry** — delete specific shipments from a registry (`DELETE /registry/{id}/shipments`).
    
- **Rename a registry** — update the name of an existing registry (`PUT /registry/{id}/rename`).
    
- **Delete a registry** — permanently remove a registry and all its content (`DELETE /registry/{id}`).

Folder contains Customer API methods for NovaPost Test environment:

[https://api-stage.novapost.pl/v.1.0](https://api-stage.novapost.pl/v.1.0)

**Main Sections:**

- Authorization
    
- Dictionaries
    
- Services
    
- Shipments
    
- Pickups
    
- Webhooks
    
- Registers
    

Please proceed with request in Authorization folder to generate a temporary JWT-token first, in order to run allfurther requests in collection for Stage environment.
